> OFF TOPIC
> Disclaimer:  see below
> 
> Bringing a newbie into OO
> =========================
> 
> I would like to ask the people on this list for 
> recommendations of the best literature to bring an OO newbie 
> up to speed.
> 
> The programming language in question is Java, which means 
> that there is a splendid wealth of online material for 
> someone to learn the language.  The important thing, however, 
> is to instill the notion of OO purity, which is harder, 
> perhaps, than just teaching the language.
> 
> For example: the GoF patterns book is a must, but I think it 
> is not a text that you can give to someone until they have a 
> grounding in OO techniques.
> 
> Your thoughts?
> 
> Manuel Amago.
> 
> -----------------------------------------------
> DISCLAIMER
> I know this group is not for this type of question, which is 
> why I explicitly labelled this thread as OT (Off Topic).  I 
> hope you will forgive my impertinence.  ;) But, I greatly 
> value the opinions of the people on this list, and I trust 
> your opinion on this particular issue.
